result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven J. Schaefer was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and any vehicle titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week unless documentation is presented to P&P of his inability to work.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
As deemed appropriate by P&P - to be completed within the first year of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven J. Schaefer in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:11 PM. State - here for a change of plea and motion hearing, case is currently set for JT tomorrow. Kennedy agrees. State - resolved - joint recommendation in part and free to argue in part - plead G to count #1 as alleged and acknowledge 3 prior unreversed convictions - dismiss count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: $2185.00 fine, restitution of $35.00 blood draw cost, 100 days of conditional jail (defense will argue for 90 days conditional time), 30 month DL suspension, 30 month IID, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or similar class B establishments, 100 hours of community service, seek employment only if approved by P&P for stated reasons (disability). State provides court with plea questionnaire, blood test results and certified driving record. Kennedy and Schaefer agree, Kennedy makes statement regarding reserving right to appeal. State responds. Court dismisses count #2. Schaefer pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Defendan acknowledges three prior OWI convictions. Court has plea questionnaire, advises the defendant of the elements of defense as attorney did not attach it to the plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow recommendation - recommends 100 days of conditional jail. Kennedy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow recommendation - argues for 90 days conditional jail for stated reasons - 14 days credit only if revoked. Schaefer withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: 100 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 14 days right away - report today, AODA and follow thru, fine of $2185.00 - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, restitution of $35.00 for blood draw to arresting agency, revoke license for 30 months, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in his name for 30 months commencing upon issuance of valid DL, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service within first year of probation, employment/school unless present documentation is presented to P&P of his inability to work, attend at least one AA/NA program each week, submit DNA sample, right to appeal. Court will now hear the motion to stay pending appeal. Kennedy states motion under 971.31(10). Court believes all that can be appealed is the suppression notice. Court will consider the appeal today, reviews statutes. Kennedy makes brief statement for request for stay. State responds, objects to request for stay. Kennedy responds. Parties argue back and forth. Court denies motion for stated reasons, defendant to report to jail today. Adjourned at 3:53 PM.
and certificate of appearance - MK subpoena with attachments
and certificate of appearance - VT - subpoena with attachents
motion hearing exhibits from 9/9/15 # 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 & 9 (only exhibits received by the court)

Court will now hear the bond forfeiture portion of the case same appearances as motion hearing. Kennedy calls Steven Schaefer to the stand. Schaefer reminded that he is still under oath. Kennedy offers exhibits #1 and #2. Court receives exhibits #1 and #2 after no real objections by State even though record not clear of what the exhibits were. Cross exam by State at 3:17 PM. Schaefer excused at 3:19 PM. Court receives exhibit #3. Kennedy makes argument for bond forfeiture motion. State makes argument regarding forfeiture. Court receives exhibit #1 and #2 but does not find #3 helpful. Court confirms forfeiture of bond and directs clerk to forfeit the bond posted. Court continues the signature of $1500.00. State - matter is not resolved as far as FPT - puts offer on the record. Kennedy states he did not talk about the plea offer to the defendant as he was waiting for the ruling on the motion hearing. Court has parties set for JT with the JA as an analyst is needed.

Defendant Steven J. Schaefer in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:12 PM. Kennedy states motion to dismiss. State stipulates that there is a doorbell. Kennedy continues his argument. Witnesses not sequestored. State calls Tom Kirby. Kennedy asks Court to take judicial notice of exhibit #1 - a federal court opinion. Court does not take judicial notice of the exhibit. Thomas Kirby sworn in at 1:20 PM. Direct exam by Kennedy. Kennedy offers exhibit #2 - lease renewal from Mole Lake Tribal Housing. State objects to exhibit #2 for stated reasons and its admission. Discussion on exhibit #2. Court sustains State's objection for the admission of exhibit #2. Kennedy responds, continues direct exam. Kennedy offers exhibit #3 - blueprint of a home basement. Court offers exhibit #4 - a copy of exhibit #3 in regards to a wood chute. Court receives exhibit #4 after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #5 - overview of house structures as they lay on the lots. State objects to exhibit #5 after no objections. Cross exam by State at 1:31 PM. Re-direct by Kennedy at 1:35 PM. Kennedy calls Vanessa Tuckwab. Tuckwab sworn in at 1:38 PM. Direct exam by Kennedy. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #6 - series of 14 photographs of witnesses house. Court receives exhibit #6 after no objections even though proper foundation was not laid. Kennedy offers exhibit #8 - google earth picture of the witnesses home. State objects to exhibit #8, no foundation laid. Court sustains. Kennedy asks Court to take judicial notice of exhibit #8. Discussion on laying the proper foundation for the exhibit. State tries to lay the foundation for the exhibit. Court receives exhibit #8 even though foundation wasn't laid. Kennedy offers exhibit #7 - google earth picture of the witnesses house roof. State has no objections. Kennedy offers exhibit #7. Court receives after no objections and no foundation laid. Cross exam by State at 1:53 PM. Cross exam by Kennedy at 1:58 PM. Court has question of witness. Tuckwab excused at 1:59 PM. Kennedy calls Steven Schaefer. Recess at 2:00 PM. Recalled at 2:35 PM. Schaefer retakes stand and is reminded that he is still under oath. Direct exam by Kennedy at 2:35 PM. Kennedy offers exhibit #9 - sketch with measurements. Kennedy moves for admission of exhibit #9. State does not believe foundation has been laid. Court will receive exhibit #9 for demonstrative for his testimony only. Kennedy attempts to lay better foundation for the entire exhibit. Kennedy objects to Court's ruling on answer. Objection overruled. Cross exam by State at 2:43 PM. Kennedy objects - hearsay. Court sustains objection. Court overrules objection after discussion. Re-direct by Kennedy at 2:46 PM. Schaefer excused at 2:47 PM. State calls Deputy Chris Tanner. Tanner sworn in at 2:47 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Kennedy at 2:51 PM. Tanner excused at 2:51 PM. Kennedy makes closing statement at 2:52 PM. State makes closing statement at 2:57 PM - asks Court to deny motion. Court makes ruling - denies motion for stated reasons. Court will now hear the bond forfeiture portion of the case. Kennedy calls Steven Schaefer to the stand. Schaefer reminded that he is still under oath. Kennedy offers exhibits #1 and #2. Court receives exhibits #1 and #2 after no real objections by State even though record not clear of what the exhibits were. Cross exam by State at 3:17 PM. Schaefer excused at 3:19 PM. Court receives exhibit #3. Kennedy makes argument for bond forfeiture motion. State makes argument regarding forfeiture. Court receives exhibit #1 and #2 but does not find #3 helpful. Court confirms forfeiture of bond and directs clerk to forfeit the bond posted. Court continues the signature of $1500.00. State - matter is not resolved as far as FPT - puts offer on the record. Kennedy states he did not talk about the plea offer to the defendant as he was waiting for the ruling on the motion hearing. Court has parties set for JT with the JA as an analyst is needed.
Terminating Judicial Assignment - sent to DA, Attorney Kennedy and defendant
Email sent to DA Simono informing date and time of motion hearing.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Bail/bond hearing at 09-09-2015 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial at 09-09-2015 01:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and may not enter any bars, taverns, or similar establishments except for work purposes.

Defendant Steven J. Schaefer in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Defendant Steven J. Schaefer in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. Court relieves Ms. Burns from further representation of the defendant and accepts Kennedy's representation today. Kennedy has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, sets matter for FPT. Kennedy - bond - address bond forfeiture - objects to forfeiture of bond for stated reasons. Court will accept oral objection and sets matter for forfeiture hearing as well at same date and time. Kennedy - bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - asks that $1500 bond be reinstated for stated reasons. Court - bond - $4000 signature bond with conditions. Kennedy asking for extension on time to file motions. Court will extend time limits for the filing of motions to 10 days after receipt of discovery.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bar/tavern

Defendant Steven J. Schaefer in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:22 AM. Schaefer does have complaint but not the Amended Complaint that was filed today. State will provide defendant with Amended Complaint and hands that Amended Complaint to Officer Thornton to provide to defendant. Court reads amended complaint and penalties, right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Schaefer understands amended charges and penalties. Schaefer believes he is going to be represented by Robert Kennedy Jr. Mr. Kennedy is not in court today. Court will adjourn the matter to later today, defendant instructed to contact Mr. Kennedy via telephone from the jail, Court faxed a list of attorneys. State - $1500 cash in addition to the $1000 that is subject to forfeiture. Court - bond - $1500.00 cash bond in addition to the bond that is subject to forfeiture, sets for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 07-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Steven J. Schaefer not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:42 am. State requests warrant and forfeit bond. $1500 bench warrant so ordered and forfeit any bond posted.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bar/tavern
